title: How to Treat a Wound – Simple First Aid Steps
description: These easy steps help you clean and protect a wound safely. Follow them to prevent infection and promote healing. Always seek medical help if the wound is serious.

sections.heading: Steps
sections.content:
1) Wash Your Hands: Use soap and water or hand sanitizer. Wear gloves if you have them.

2) Stop the Bleeding: Press gently on the wound with a clean cloth or bandage. Keep pressing until the bleeding stops (a few minutes).

3) Clean the Wound: Rinse the wound gently with clean water. Use mild soap around the wound (not inside). Remove dirt with tweezers if needed (clean them first with alcohol).

4) Apply Antiseptic: Use an antiseptic wipe or cream (like Betadine or Dettol) to kill germs.

5) Cover the Wound: Use a band-aid for small cuts. Use gauze and tape for larger wounds. Don’t wrap too tightly.

6) Keep It Clean: Change the bandage daily or if it gets wet or dirty. Watch for signs of infection (redness, swelling, pus, pain).

7) Get Help if Needed: If the wound is deep, keeps bleeding, or looks infected — see a doctor.
